name: Hotel Terminus Lyon

reviews.text: We have taken to staying at the Terminus Lyon on all of our short visits to Paris (about 3 or 4 a year). The major advantage that it has is its location. It is directly opposite the Gare de Lyon and so is ideal if the stay is in connection with a trip by the TGV to many destinations in the South of France. Even nearer is the entrance to the Metro and RER station giving quick and easy access to the whole of Paris and the banlieue. The Bastille Opera (the cause of a number of our visits to Paris) is a short walk away. From a gastronomic point of view, this is not the best of Parisian locations (although Le Train Bleu - the railway station restaurant up the belle epoch staircase from the main station concourse, NOT the eponymously named buffet directly beneath it on the ground floor - is well worth a visit, both for its cuisine and for the beauty of its dining room). However, there are a couple of perfectly serviceable brasseries nearby that keep the sort of late hours that operagoers need (the one directly under the hotel is ideal if your fancy is for a gut-busting Alsatian choucroute!), and the public transport links make easy trips to temples of gastronomy elsewhere.
reviews.title: Convenient location

reviews.text: We picked this hotel because of its proximity to the Omnisports Bercy and the railway station, having read the reviews on this site. The price is very good for central Paris.
reviews.title: Pleasant and Convenient

reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and helpful, and speak enough English to be useful to those visitors who don't speak any French. The beds are comfortable, and the rooms clean, and the bathroom was a perfectly adequate size with all reasonable amenities for the price. The breakfast was nice, and the service fine. The one slight problem, if your room faces the station, is that you must have the window closed and the air-conditioning on, but the ac is quite noisy.

reviews.text: The location and price are the big advantages of this hotel. You can get on the Metro, the RER and SNCF just over the road, there are very nice little cafe/bars either side of the hotel, and it is walkable distance to all sorts of restaurants.
All in all, this was a pleasant experience. Next time I'm going to see an Aerosmith gig at the Bercy, that's where I'll stay!
reviews.title: Convenient and friendly

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel while passing through Paris just before Christmas on our way to Disneyland. We were travelling as a family with 2 kids aged 15 & 12. Picked this hotel because we only had one day in Paris (travelled from Dublin with Ryanair to Beauvais). I have to say that this was an excellent choice,not only for cost but also the position. We paid €132.00 for a quad room which we felt was good value. The room had 2 large double beds and a bathroom with double sinks. The room was clean and the bathroom was spotless. After an effecient check in we threw the bags in the room and planned to go sightseeing to make the most of our one day. Our room was facing the street but there was very little noise, even at night. The lady on reception was excellent, gave us maps and advised us how to get to certain sites the best way..we actually walked to Notre Dame from the hotel as it was quicker! Notre Dame was beautiful, candle-lit with xmas hymns being played. We also managed to climb the Eiffel Tower and go to the Louvre (free entry on Tuesday nights).
